creator: nettings@apache.org
text:
many xinclude statements in lenya use the deprecated fragment identifier syntax
to specify xpointers. this causes the following WARN message:

  Fragment identifer found in 'href' attribute: 
  Fragment identifiers are forbidden by the XInclude specification.
  They are still handled by XIncludeTransformer for backward compatibility, but
  their use is deprecated and will be prohibited in a future release.
  Use the 'xpointer' attribute instead.

the correct way is to use the xpointer="" attribute instead.

references: 
http://www.w3.org/TR/xinclude/
http://www.w3.org/TR/xinclude/#fragment-example

Created attachment 18818
changes all fragment-identifier notations to xpointer="..."

this patch moves all xpointers from deprecated fragment identifier notation to
xpointer="" attributes in xi:include statements.

this patch works for me with a custom publication. it touches the blog example
publication as well, but that is untested, because blog does not work for me.

the patch uses the xpointer() scheme because i wanted to keep the old uris
without introducing semantic changes. however, the xpointer() scheme is not
part of the xinclude core specification.  it is supported by the
XIncludeTransformer, but we might want to find a more generic solution. but the
w3c recommendations made my head hurt before i could figure how to do that. any
takers?
